isis.stitle: HOOD, GRILLE AND FENDERS - 2000, 4000, 8000 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - 8000 SERIES HOOD

svcsubproc.title: 8100 Model Hood (Before June 1994) - Remove

step1.para: Release hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the support spring cable assemblies, then detach the support spring cable assemblies as follows.
Refer to Figure 34 for items in parentheses.

step2.para: Remove the cotter pin (Item 1) (and washer, if so equipped) at the support spring cable bracket (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 3), passenger side shown.
Pull out the retaining pin (Item 4) that secures the support spring cable assembly clevis (Item 5) to the support spring cable bracket (Item 2), passenger side shown.
Repeat procedure to remove the driver side support spring cable assembly.

step1.para: Disconnect front end wire harness connector and ground connections on the engine side of dash panel on the drivers side, also disconnect pigtail connectors along the front end wire harness. Remove wire harness clips and loop clamps securing the harness between dash panel and hood, as necessary. (The harness stays with the hood.)

If the vehicle has a International electronic engine, disconnect front end wire harness connectors near the rear of the engine on the drivers side, and ground connections. Remove wire harness clips and loop clamps securing the harness between the connectors and hood, as necessary. (The harness stays with the hood.)

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 35 for items in parentheses.

step1.para: To remove the hood, remove the cotter pin (Item 1) and flat washer (Item 2) from each of the hood hinge pins (Item 3), then remove the hinge pin from each hood and chassis hinge sections (Items 4 and 5), passenger side shown.
With an assistant, remove the hood assembly. Place the hood on an appropriate padded surface to protect painted surfaces.

svcsubproc.title: 8100 Model Hood (Before June 1994) - Install
svcsubproc.para: If required, assemble support spring cables, splash panels, insulator panels and the hood hinge plates to the hood before installing it.
Refer to Figure 35 for items in parentheses.

step1.para: Place a padded work stand in front of the vehicle. With an assistant, rest the hood assembly on the work stand. Position the hood hinge section (Item 4) in place at the chassis hinge section (Item 5) and install the hood hinge pins (Item 3) from the inboard side into each hinge, passenger side shown.
Install flat washer (Item 2) on each of the hinge pins (Item 3) and secure with cotter pins (Item 1), passenger side shown.

Connect front end wire harness connector and ground connections to the appropriate engine side dash panel connectors on the drivers side, also connect pigtail connectors along the front end wire harness. Secure the wire harness with the clips and loop clamps provided, as necessary.

If the vehicle has a International electronic engine, connect front end wire harness connectors near the rear of the engine on drivers side, and ground connections. Install wire harness clips and loop clamps securing the harness between the connectors and hood, as necessary.

Carefully tilt the hood to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the support spring cable assemblies, then attach the support spring cable assemblies to the mounting brackets on top of the radiator as follows.
Refer to Figure 34 for items in parentheses.

step2.para: Position the support spring assembly clevis (Item 5) at the support spring cable bracket (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 3), passenger side shown.
Install the retaining pin (Item 4) (and washer, if so equipped), securing the support spring cable assembly clevis (Item 5) to the support spring cable bracket (Item 2), passenger side shown.
Install the cotter pin (Item 1) in the retaining pin (Item 4) securing the retaining pin at the support spring cable bracket (Item 2), passenger side shown.
Repeat procedure to install the driver side support spring cable assembly.

step1.para: Close the hood and latch the hood on both sides.

svcsubproc.title: 8100 Model Hood (After June 1994) - Remove

step1.para: Release hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist and support spring cable assemblies, then detach the support spring cable assemblies as follows.
Refer to Figure 34 for items in parentheses.

step2.para: Remove the cotter pin (Item 1) (and washer, if so equipped) at the support spring cable bracket (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 3), passenger side shown.
Pull out the retaining pin (Item 4) that secures the support spring cable assembly clevis (Item 5) to the support spring cable bracket (Item 2), passenger side shown.
Repeat procedure to remove the driver side support spring cable assembly.

step1.para: Disconnect front end wire harness connector and ground connections on the engine side of dash panel on the drivers side, also disconnect pigtail connectors along the front end wire harness. Remove wire harness clips and loop clamps securing the harness between dash panel and hood, as necessary. (The harness stays with the hood.)

If the vehicle has a International electronic engine, disconnect front end wire harness connectors near the rear of the engine on the drivers side, and ground connections. Remove wire harness clips and loop clamps securing the harness between the connectors and hood, as necessary. (The harness stays with the hood.)

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 36 for items in parentheses.

step1.para: To remove the hood, remove the hex hinge pin bolt, flat washers and hex lock nut (Items 1 and 2) from the hood hinge and hinge yoke sections (Items 3 and 4).

step1.para: With an assistant, remove the hood assembly. Place the hood on an appropriate padded surface to protect painted surfaces.

svcsubproc.title: 8100 Model Hood (After June 1994) - Install
svcsubproc.para: If required, assemble support spring cables, splash panels, insulator panels and hinge bushings to the hood before installing it.
Refer to Figure 36 for items in parentheses.

step1.para: Place a padded work stand in front of the vehicle. With an assistant, rest the hood assembly on the work stand. Position the hood hinge section (Item 3) in place at the hinge yoke section (Item 4) and install the hex hinge pin bolt and flat washer (Item 1) from the outboard side into each hinge (Items 3 and 4), then install the flat washer and hex lock nut (Item 2) on the hex hinge pin bolt. Tighten to 50 to 55 ft-lbs. (68 to 75 Nm).

Connect front end wire harness connector and ground connections to the appropriate engine side dash panel connectors on the drivers side, also connect pigtail connectors along the front end wire harness. Secure the wire harness with the clips and loop clamps provided, as necessary.

If the vehicle has a International electronic engine, connect front end wire harness connectors near the rear of the engine on drivers side, and ground connections. Install wire harness clips and loop clamps securing the harness between the connectors and hood, as necessary.

Carefully tilt the hood to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the support spring cable assemblies, then attach the support spring cable assemblies to the mounting brackets on top of the radiator as follows.
Refer to Figure 34 for items in parentheses.

step2.para: Position the support spring cable assembly clevis (Item 5) at the support spring cable bracket (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 3), passenger side shown.
Install the retaining pin (Item 4) (and washer, if so equipped), securing the support spring cable assembly clevis (Item 5) to the support spring cable bracket (Item 2), passenger side shown.
Install the cotter pin (Item 1) in the retaining pin (Item 4) securing the retaining pin at the support spring cable bracket (Item 2), passenger side shown.
Repeat procedure to install the driver side support spring cable assembly.

step1.para: Close the hood and latch the hood on both sides.

svcsubproc.title: 8200 Model Hood - Remove

step1.para: Release hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist and support spring cable assemblies, then detach the tilt assist and support spring cable assemblies as follows.
Refer to Figure 37 for items in parentheses.

step2.para: Remove the cotter pin (Item 1) (and washer, if so equipped) at the support spring cable bracket (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 3), enlarged view driver side shown.
Pull out retaining pin (Item 4) that secures the support spring cable clevis (Item 5) to the support spring cable bracket (Item 2), enlarged view driver side shown.
Remove the cotter pin (Item 7) (and washer, if so equipped) at the tilt assist spring cable bracket (Item 8) on the side of the radiator (Item 3), enlarged view driver side shown.
Pull out retaining pin (Item 9) that secures the tilt assist spring cable clevis (Item 10) to the tilt assist spring cable bracket (Item 8), enlarged view driver side shown.
Repeat procedure to remove the passenger side upper support spring cable assembly and side tilt assist spring cable assembly.

step1.para: Disconnect front end wire harness connector and ground connections on the engine side of dash panel on the drivers side, also disconnect pigtail connectors along the front end wire harness. Remove wire harness clips and loop clamps securing harness between dash panel and hood, as necessary. (The harness stays with the hood.)

If the vehicle has a International electronic engine, disconnect front end wire harness connectors near the rear of the engine on the drivers side, and ground connections. Remove wire harness clips and loop clamps securing the harness between the connectors and hood, as necessary. (The harness stays with the hood.)

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 38 for items in parentheses.

step1.para: To remove the hood, remove the cotter pin (Item 1) and flat washer (Item 2) from each of the hood hinge pins (Item 3), then remove the hinge pin from the hood and chassis hinge sections (Items 4 and 5), driver side shown.
With an assistant, remove the hood assembly. Place the hood on an appropriate padded surface to protect painted surfaces.

svcsubproc.title: 8200 Model Hood - Install
svcsubproc.para: If required, install tilt assist and support spring cable assemblies, splash panels, insulator panels and the hood hinge assembly to the hood before installing it.
Refer to Figure 38 for items in parentheses.

step1.para: Place a padded work stand in front of the vehicle. With an assistant, rest the hood assembly on the work stand. Position the hood hinge section (Item 4) in place at the chassis hinge section (Item 5) and install the hood hinge pins (Item 3) from the inboard side into each hinge, driver side shown.
Install flat washer (Item 2) on each of the hood hinge pins (Item 3) and secure with cotter pins (Item 1), driver side shown.

Connect front end wire harness connector and ground connections to the appropriate engine side dash panel connectors on the drivers side, also connect pigtail connectors along the front end wire harness. Secure the wire harness with the clips and loop clamps provided, as necessary.

If the vehicle has a International electronic engine, connect front end wire harness connectors near the rear of the engine on drivers side, and ground connections. Install wire harness clips and loop clamps securing the harness between the connectors and hood, as necessary.

Carefully tilt the hood to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist and support spring cable assemblies, then attach the tilt assist and support spring cable assemblies to the mounting brackets on top of the radiator as follows.
Refer to Figure 37 for items in parentheses.

step2.para: Position the support spring cable clevis (Item 5) at the support spring cable bracket (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 3), driver side shown.
Install the retaining pin (Item 4) (and washer, if so equipped), securing the support spring cable clevis (Item 5) to the support spring cable bracket (Item 2), driver side shown.
Install the cotter pin (Item 1) in the retaining pin (Item 4) securing the retaining pin at the support spring cable bracket (Item 2), driver side shown.
Position the tilt assist spring cable clevis (Item 10) at the tilt assist spring cable bracket (Item 8) on the side of the radiator (Item 3), driver side shown.
Install the retaining pin (Item 9) (and washer, if so equipped), securing the tilt assist spring cable clevis (Item 10) to the tilt assist spring cable bracket (Item 8), driver side shown.
Install the cotter pin (Item 7) in the retaining pin (Item 9) securing the retaining pin at the tilt assist spring cable bracket (Item 8), driver side shown.
Repeat procedure to install the passenger side support spring cable assembly and tilt assist spring cable assembly.

step1.para: Close the hood and latch the hood on both sides.
